physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient 1 exhibited right-sided weakness greater than left in limbs; preserved deep tendon reflexes at ankles; normal serum creatine kinase (CK) levels; skeletal asymmetry noted on X-rays. Patient 2 had left-sided weakness in arm, hand, and leg; chest X-ray showed elevated left hemidiaphragm. Patient 4 had left arm weakness and an elevated left hemidiaphragm on chest X-ray; normal CK levels and brain MRI.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Skeletal asymmetry and weakness noted early in life; generalized weakness progressed during mid-life.
